description: Functions to interact with `duckdb_vector`. A vector typically (but not always) lives in a data chunk and contains a subset of the rows of a column.

comment.description: Creates a flat vector. Must be destroyed with `duckdb_destroy_vector`.

param_comments.type: The logical type of the vector.

comment.description: Destroys the vector and de-allocates its memory.

Retrieves the column type of the specified vector.

The result must be destroyed with `duckdb_destroy_logical_type`.

param_comments.vector: The vector get the data from

comment.description:
Retrieves the data pointer of the vector.

The data pointer can be used to read or write values from the vector.
How to read or write values depends on the type of the vector.

param_comments.vector: The vector to get the data from
The vector to get the data from

comment.return_value: The pointer to the validity mask, or NULL if no validity mask is present

comment.description:
Ensures the validity mask is writable by allocating it.

After this function is called, `duckdb_vector_get_validity` will ALWAYS return non-NULL.
This allows NULL values to be written to the vector, regardless of whether a validity mask was present before.
Assigns a string element in the vector at the specified location.

param_comments.index: The row position in the vector to assign the string to

comment.description: Assigns a string element in the vector at the specified location. You may also use this function to assign BLOBs.

param_comments.index: The row position in the vector to assign the string to
param_comments.str_len: The length of the string (in bytes)

comment.description:
Retrieves the child vector of a list vector.

The resulting vector is valid as long as the parent vector is valid.
Returns the size of the child vector of the list.
comment.return_value: The size of the child list

comment.description:
Sets the size of the underlying child-vector of a list vector.
Note that this does NOT reserve the memory in the child buffer,
and that it is possible to set a size exceeding the capacity.
To set the capacity, use `duckdb_list_vector_reserve`.

param_comments.size: The size of the child list.

comment.return_value: The duckdb state. Returns DuckDBError, if the vector is nullptr.

comment.description:
Sets the capacity of the underlying child-vector of a list vector.
We increment to the next power of two, based on the required capacity.
Thus, the capacity might not match the size of the list (capacity >= size),
which is set via `duckdb_list_vector_set_size`.

param_comments.required_capacity: The child buffer capacity to reserve.

comment.return_value: The duckdb state. Returns DuckDBError, if the vector is nullptr.

comment.description:
Retrieves the child vector of a struct vector.
The resulting vector is valid as long as the parent vector is valid.

Retrieves the child vector of an array vector.
The resulting vector is valid as long as the parent vector is valid.
The resulting vector has the size of the parent vector multiplied by the array size.

Slice a vector with a selection vector.
The length of the selection vector must be less than or equal to the length of the vector.
Turns the vector into a dictionary vector.

param_comments.len: The length of the selection vector.

comment.description: Copy the src vector to the dst with a selection vector that identifies which indices to copy.

param_comments.sel: The selection vector. The length of the selection vector should not be more than the length of the src vector
param_comments.src_count: The number of entries from selection vector to copy. Think of this as the effective length of the selection vector starting from index 0
param_comments.src_offset: The offset in the selection vector to copy from (important: actual number of items copied = src_count - src_offset).
param_comments.dst_offset: The offset in the dst vector to start copying to.

param_comments.value: The value to copy into the vector.

comment.description: Changes `to_vector` to reference `from_vector. After, the vectors share ownership of the data.
